title: Software Developer Intern
responsibilities: Design and develop scalable software applications using modern development frameworks like React,Angular,Node etc.,.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Collaborate with team members to define, design, and ship new features.
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
Troubleshoot, debug, and upgrade existing software.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and apply them into operations and activities.
requirements: Proficiency in programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, or Java.
Understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC).
Knowledge of version control systems like Git.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

title: UI/UX Designer Intern
responsibilities: Design intuitive, user-centered interfaces for digital products.
Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes using tools like Figma or Adobe XD.
Collaborate with product managers and developers to define user flows.
Conduct usability testing and iterate designs based on feedback.
Maintain a consistent visual design across products.
requirements: Familiarity with Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD.
Basic understanding of UX research and usability principles.
Good visual design skills and attention to detail.
Ability to take feedback constructively.
Portfolio showcasing UI/UX projects is a plus.

title: QA Intern
responsibilities: Execute test cases (manual or automated) and analyze results.
Collaborate with developers and product managers to understand requirements.
Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs.
Perform regression testing after bug resolution.
Help troubleshoot issues and review test procedures.
requirements: Familiarity with software testing concepts.
Knowledge of testing tools like Selenium or JMeter is a plus.
Detail-oriented and analytical thinker.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work in a team environment.

title: Photography & Videography Intern
responsibilities: Capture high-quality photos and videos for marketing and documentation.
Edit photos and videos using tools like Adobe Premiere Pro or Photoshop.
Collaborate with the content and marketing team to meet creative goals.
Organize and maintain digital asset libraries.
Assist in setting up lighting, equipment, and scenes.
requirements: Basic knowledge of DSLR cameras and video equipment.
Familiarity with editing software like Adobe Premiere or Final Cut.
Creative eye and attention to detail.
Portfolio of previous photography/videography work.
Ability to work under deadlines and manage multiple tasks.
